column4: Hi, I'm having trouble trying to compile anything with GTK. I am told that the gtk/gtk.h include is not found. However, I'm pretty certain that I've installed GTK and gtk-dev
What should I do?
sudo apt-get install libgtk1.2-dev
it is already installed.
what are you tring to build?
not familuar with the toshiba tools..
it's irrelevant. Its the fact that including gtk/gtk.h doesn't work in the source
I suspect that if I tried to do the GTK hello world program, it would do just the same
is there a gtk.h in /usr/include/gtk?
the gtk/gtk.h  is in referance to /usr/include..  so might need a simlink or something
I'll give that a shot and let you know. Glad to have help instead of messageboards filled with "Go install gtk!"
like alot of code made by these hardware manufactures it fairly messed up..  probably dosn't get the correct information out of pkg-config for gtk
it's actually user created
is it giving you this error on ./configure?
I just hope that it'll actually do something for me. I'm sick of the absurdly long load times.
make depend.
hmm , sound like toshiba need to learn how to make configure files..
it's not toshiba, it's a "fan" created set of utils
ok
if you're here, I get the feeling that you know this one :)
